data.title: Grant
data.meta_description: What is the meaning of the name Grant? Discover the origin, popularity, Grant name meaning, and names related to Grant with Mama Natural’s fantastic baby names guide.
data.text:
Grant Name Origin: English

Pronunciation: gr(ant)

See what 8 people think about Grant

Grant Name Meaning

The name Grant is a strong, solid name with a straightforward meaning: “great” or “big.” It suggests someone who is tall and strong, both physically and mentally. It also suggests someone who is generous and willing to give, which is a positive trait to have.

Origins of the Name Grant

The name Grant has roots in both Old English and Scottish cultures. In Old English, the name Grant comes from the word “grant” meaning “tall” or “great.” In Scotland, the name Grant is derived from a nickname for someone who was “grant” or “big.”

Popularity of the Name Grant

The name Grant has been a consistent presence in the baby name charts for decades. It reached its peak popularity in the late 19th century and early 20th century, but it has never truly fallen out of favor. In fact, it has been steadily rising in popularity in recent years. It’s currently sitting at around the 300th most popular name for boys in the United States.

Famous Grants

There are plenty of famous men named Grant, but here are a few notable ones:

Ulysses S. Grant, the 18th president of the United States. He served two terms in office and is best known for leading the Union army to victory during the Civil War.

Cary Grant, a classic Hollywood actor known for his debonair charm and good looks. He appeared in over 70 films during his career.

Grant Gustin, an actor best known for his role as Barry Allen/The Flash on the CW series of the same name.

Grant Achatz, an American chef and restaurateur who is the owner and head chef of Alinea, Next, and Roister restaurants in Chicago.

Final Thoughts on the Name Grant

The name Grant may not be the most popular or trendy name out there, but it has a rich history and a strong meaning behind it. It suggests someone who is tall, strong, and generous. Plus, with a plethora of famous Grants, from Presidents to Hollywood actors, it’s a name that has stood the test of time. So, if you’re looking for a name that’s classic and timeless, Grant may be the perfect fit for your little one.
